title: Has anyone messed with fixing RAM issues on an 820-3462 or other fixed-RAM board?
message: Non-spill board. Memory test failed in ASD. Computer acts like a computer acts when RAM is bad - lots of random failures. Has anyone attempted to fix a board with fixed RAM chips? Seems like a disaster, but I'm always up for trying, or at least thinking about trying.

title: Has anyone messed with fixing RAM issues on an 820-3462 or other fixed-RAM board?
message: Pull and replace all RAM chips. Nightmare, but very possible to fix of course.

title: Has anyone messed with fixing RAM issues on an 820-3462 or other fixed-RAM board?
message: You might want to see Louis video regarding RAM chip reflow before replacing

title: Has anyone messed with fixing RAM issues on an 820-3462 or other fixed-RAM board?
message: Thanks, will do. Any idea what it's called? Pretty hard time finding it so far.

title: Has anyone messed with fixing RAM issues on an 820-3462 or other fixed-RAM board?
message: Yeah, can't find it. Let me know if you know which one it is. Thanks

title: Has anyone messed with fixing RAM issues on an 820-3462 or other fixed-RAM board?
message: Don't reflow if this was not liquid damage.
